data.title: config.name = "PROJECT_NAME" in templates ?
data.body:
I'd suggest a change in the options.rpy of the templates:

config.window_title = u"PROJECT_NAME"
config.name = "PROJECT_NAME"

instead of "A Ren'Py Game"

The lines are:

templates/english/options.rpy: lines 26, 30
templates/japanese/options.rpy: lines 38, 45
templates/spanish/options.rpy: lines 26, 30

I haven't done a pull request because I don't know if this can have side effects.

data.title: Set mouse pos
data.body:
I added renpy.set_mouse_pos(x, y) and renpy.mouse_move(x, y, limit) which jumps or moves the mouse pointer to the given location.
And I also added Actions corresponding to these function, and Preferences which enable or disable these Action.

def set_mouse_pos(x, y):
    """
    Jump the mouse pointer to the location given by arguments x and y.
    If a android device, this does nothing.
    """
def mouse_move(x, y, limit):
    """
    Move the mouse pointer to the location given by arguments x and y in
    `limit` seconds.
    If a android device, this does nothing.
    """
class MouseJump(Action):
    """
    Jump the mouse pointer to the location given by arguments x and y.
    If a android device or _preferences.mouse_move is False, this does
    nothing.
    """
class MouseMove(Action):
    """
    Move the mouse pointer to the location given by arguments x and y in
    `limit` seconds.
    If a android device or _preferences.mouse_move is False, this does
    nothing.
    """
Preference("automatic move", "enable") - Enable automatic mouse mode.
Preference("automatic move", "disable") - Disable automatic mouse mode.
Preference("automatic move", "toggle") - Toggle automatic mouse mode.

data.title: Fullscreen on lower sceen resolution with higher resolution widescreen games
data.body:
System:
Windows XP SP3 with DirectX 9.0c installed

When I run widescreen games and then fullscreen them, the buttons and sliders start acting strangely and only respond when I'm a few cm (inches) below it.

In the screenshot (from RE: Prince of Nigeria), the Stop Skipping Button has lit up. The cut-off that happens there doesn't happen in any other game I've tried. It works fine with games that are of a lower resolution than my screen and it didn't effect a Ren'py 6.13 widescreen game I've played recently.

Screenshot:
![fullscreen](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/983358/1524577/498993dc-4bc8-11e3-87ea-5e8e85a381bc.jpg)

The log.txt follows:

```
Tue Nov 12 20:18:05 2013
Windows-XP-5.1.2600-SP3
Ren'Py 6.14.1.366
RE Prince of Nigeria 1.0


Windowed mode.
Screen sizes: virtual=(1280, 768) physical=(922, 553)
Vendor: 'SiS DMA'
Renderer: '630/730 / MMX'
Version: '2.06'
Display Info: <VideoInfo(hw = 0, wm = 1,video_mem = 0
         blit_hw = 0, blit_hw_CC = 0, blit_hw_A = 0,
         blit_sw = 0, blit_sw_CC = 0, blit_sw_A = 0,
         bitsize  = 32, bytesize = 4,
         masks =  (16711680, 65280, 255, 0),
         shifts = (16, 8, 0, 0),
         losses =  (0, 0, 0, 8),
         current_w = 1024, current_h = 768
>

Fixed-function is blacklisted.
Extensions:

    GL_ARB_multitexture
    GL_EXT_abgr
    GL_EXT_bgra
    GL_EXT_compiled_vertex_array
    GL_EXT_packed_pixels
    GL_EXT_texture_object
    GL_EXT_vertex_array
    GL_SGIS_multitexture
    GL_WIN_swap_hint
Number of texture units: 2
Can't find a workable environment.

Windowed mode.
Initializing EGL: Error initializing EGL (egl error 0x3001)
The window was minimized.
The window was restored.
The window was minimized.
The window was restored.
```

data.title: During trans3
data.body:
I added window statements the window auto statement.
Showing the window is dependent on _preferences.during_trans If this is used.

If _preferences.during_trans is set to "window" and the window auto statement is used, the window is shown during transitions.
If _preferences.during_trans is set to "string" and the window auto statement is used, text is also shown during transitions.
If _preferences.during_trans is set to False and the window auto statement is used, it is the same that the window hide statement is used.

And the window is hidden automatically when the scene statement is used even if the window auto statement is used.

data.body:
When clicking on the "Back" button in the following screen:

```
Full traceback:

    renpy.main.main()
  File "/home/daniel/Descargas/renpy/renpy/main.py", line 327, in main
```

data.title: add renpy.get_mouse_pos()
data.body:
I added renpy.get_mouse_pos().
it returns False if a android device, otherwise returns tuple which gives the coordinate of the location of the mouse.

data.title: Added lines to the README to give more information on getting and working with the renpy package.
data.body:
- The changes made were based mostly on the discussions in IRC and Email.
- The multiple commits to this file were simply small fixes on the look of the file in github's markdown/rst.
- willing to expand if needed
- need someone to test this on OSX, I tried the commands in Linux and Windows successfully.

data.title: TypeError: Environment can only contain strings.
data.body:
When I try to open game files from the launcher I'm getting the following message:
"Error: An Exception occurred while launching the text editor: TypeError: Environment can only contain strings."

I did some playing around and it seems that checking the script with the LINT button also triggers a similar error message, this one with a traceback.

http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=23890&view=unread#p297350

data.title: I can't translate "FILENAME"
data.body:
i'm translating Ren'Py launcher into Spanish. After translating the file "game/add_file.rpy", i saw that "FILENAME" is not translated.

My translation:
![ren py launcher_001](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1286535/1491816/c1687dca-47b6-11e3-9c5c-1dc910dfd32b.png)

``` python
# game/add_file.rpy:7
old "FILENAME"
new "Nombre del archivo"
```

I tested with Japanese translation and also happens.
![ren py launcher_002](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1286535/1491850/9ee52d24-47b7-11e3-84f3-44b400d68723.png)

This also happens with "game/new_project.rpy".
![ren py launcher_003](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1286535/1491886/15d2c504-47b8-11e3-92d2-c9b5be300214.png)

``` python
# game/new_project.rpy:55
old "PROJECT NAME"
new "プロジェクト名"
```

```

While running game code:
```
